item.title: Sarah add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Any fool can know. The point is to understand." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Understanding is the first step to acceptance, and only with acceptance can there be recovery." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "How much can we ever know about the love and pain in another heart? How much can we hope to understand those who have suffered deeper anguish, greater deprivation, and more crushing disappointments than we ourselves have known?" -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Joss Whedon
Sarah add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I call him religious who understands the suffering of others." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "No adolescent ever wants to be understood, which is why they complain about being misunderstood all the time." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Whitney Otto
item.description: "…she eventually forgave him, because she understood him." -- Whitney Otto

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Don't be in a hurry to condemn because he doesn't do what you do or think as you think or as fast. There was a time when you didn't know what you know today." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sarah add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The Bible tells us to love our neighbors, and also to love our enemies; probably because generally they are the same people." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't "try" to do things. You simply "must" do things." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "It is easy enough to be friendly to one's friends. But to befriend the one who regards himself as your enemy is the quintessence of true religion. The other is mere business." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Now there is a final reason I think that Jesus says, "Love your enemies." It is this: that love has within it a redemptive power. And there is a power there that eventually transforms individuals. Just keep being friendly to that person. Just keep loving them, and they can’t stand it too long. Oh, they react in many ways in the beginning. They react with guilt feelings, and sometimes they’ll hate you a little more at that transition period, but just keep loving them. And by the power of your love they will break down under the load. That’s love, you see. It is redemptive, and this is why Jesus says love. There’s something about love that builds up and is creative. There is something about hate that tears down and is destructive. So love your enemies. (from "Loving Your Enemies")" -- Martin Luther King Jr.
